long life/old age/age/life/birthday/funerary
surname Shou
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: Happy birthday, Tom, and many happy returns!
sentences.chinese: 生日快樂，湯姆，並祝你福如東海，壽比南山。

sentences.english: Here, I wish you longevity elderly family Rudong sea, pine.
sentences.chinese: 在此，我祝願爸爸您老人家福如東海水，壽比南山松。

sentences.english: I wish you bounty happiness and longevity of Methuselah.
sentences.chinese: 我祝您福如東海，壽比南山。

sentences.english: Then I wish my grandma don't live as long as the southern mountain pines.
sentences.chinese: 接着我又祝奶奶壽比南山不老松。

definition: may your happiness be as immense as the East Sea (idiom)
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
Happy New Year
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
glorious and flourishing (idiom); thriving
having ample food and clothing (idiom); well fed and clothed
happiness and longevity
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
